column2: Does the patient(s) represent(s) the whole experience of the investigator (center) or is the selection method unclear to the extent that other patients with similar presentation may not have been reported? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column3: Was patient’s causal exposure clearly described? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column4: Were diagnostic tests or assessment methods and the results clearly described (amnesia tests)? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column5: Were other alternative causes that may explain the observation (amnesia) ruled out? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column6: Were patient’s demographics, medical history, comobidities clearly described? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column7: Were patient’s symptoms, interventions, and clinical outcomes clearly presented as a timeline? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column8: Was the lesion image taken around the time of observation (amnesia) assessment? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
column9: Is the case(s) described with sufficient details to allow other investigators to replicate the research or to allow practitioners make inferences related to their own practice? (Good/Bad/Unclear)
